author: Albert Einstein
text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

author: Steve Jobs
text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.

author: Maya Angelou
text: Try to be a rainbow in someone’s cloud.

author: Walt Disney
text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

author: Nelson Mandela
text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.

author: Mother Teresa
text: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

author: Confucius
text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: Mark Twain
text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

author: Oprah Winfrey
text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.

author: Yoda
text: Do or do not. There is no try.

author: Dr. Seuss
text: You’re off to great places! Today is your day!

author: Barack Obama
text: The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something.

author: John Wooden
text: Things work out best for those who make the best of how things work out.

author: Tony Robbins
text: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.

author: Buddha
text: What you think, you become. What you feel, you attract. What you imagine, you create.

author: Henry Ford
text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.

author: J.K. Rowling
text: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.

author: Jim Rohn
text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.

author: Helen Keller
text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.

author: Kevin Kruse
text: Life isn’t about getting and having, it’s about giving and being.

author: Napoleon Hill
text: Whatever the mind of man can conceive and believe, it can achieve.

author: Robert Frost
text: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.

author: Florence Nightingale
text: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any excuse.

author: Wayne Gretzky
text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.

author: Michael Jordan
text: I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.

author: Amelia Earhart
text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.

author: Babe Ruth
text: Every strike brings me closer to the next home run.

author: W. Clement Stone
text: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.

author: John Lennon
text: Life is what happens to you while you’re busy making other plans.

author: Earl Nightingale
text: We become what we think about.

author: Mark Twain
text: Explore. Dream. Discover.

author: Charles Swindoll
text: Life is 10% what happens to me and 90% of how I react to it.

author: Alice Walker
text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don’t have any.

author: Chinese Proverb
text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.

author: Socrates
text: An unexamined life is not worth living.

author: Woody Allen
text: Eighty percent of success is showing up.

author: Vince Lombardi
text: Winning isn’t everything, but wanting to win is.

author: Stephen Covey
text: I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.

author: Pablo Picasso
text: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
